marketNews.title: Sri Mulyani Replaced by Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa as Finance Minister
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto today, Monday (8/9), replaced Sri Mulyani from the position of Finance Minister, a position she has held for almost 14 years in the last 20 years. As her replacement, President Prabowo inaugurated Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, who since 2020 has served as the chairman of the board of commissioners at the Deposit Insurance Corporation (Lembaga Penjamin Simpanan). Following this decision, the IHSG closed down -1.28% at 7,767 today, with the one-month NDF rupiah against the US dollar weakening -1.07% to 16,585 this afternoon. Before the reshuffle today, Sri Mulyani had indeed been frequently rumored to resign from her position. Rumors of Sri Mulyani's resignation resurfaced at the end of August 2025, after a mob looted her house at the peak of demonstrations. The State Secretary Minister, Prasetyo Hadi, in a press conference today only explained that the removal of Sri Mulyani from her position was the prerogative right of the president. According to Bloomberg, Sri Mulyani was a symbol of fiscal credibility for the last 3 Indonesian presidents, widely acknowledged for having helped Indonesia secure investment-grade credit ratings. Meanwhile, Purbaya previously served in government as a deputy at the Coordinating Ministry for Maritime Affairs and Investment and as a special staffer at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs. Before entering government, Purbaya served as a senior economist at Danareksa Research Institute and President Director of PT Danareksa Sekuritas.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The reshuffle of the Finance Minister position was responded to negatively by the market, likely due to a perceived increase in uncertainty regarding government fiscal discipline. Some metrics to monitor in the short term are: 1) foreign flow in the bond and stock markets after this reshuffle; and 2) the movement of government bond yields and the rupiah exchange rate. For bond yields, besides movements in the secondary market yields, investors can also monitor the results of primary market auctions scheduled for tomorrow, Tuesday (9/9). In the longer term, investors can monitor fiscal policy and its effectiveness in driving economic growth. In the short term, for investors wanting to be more defensive currently, they can consider consumer stocks that have strong balance sheets (net cash/low leverage) and relatively low currency risk, such as SIDO, MYOR, and CMRY.

marketNews.title: US Labor Statistics Bureau reported that non-farm payrolls (NFP) in August 2025 only increased by 22,000, below the consensus expectation of 75,000.
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that non-farm payrolls (NFP) in August 2025 only increased by 22,000, below the consensus expectation of 75,000. Meanwhile, the NFP data for July 2025 was revised from an increase of 73,000 to an increase of 79,000. Furthermore, the NFP for the June 2025 period was revised from an increase of 14,000 to a decrease of 13,000, marking the first decline since December 2020. The unemployment rate increased from 4.2% in July 2025 to 4.3% in August 2025, marking the highest level since October 2021. Responding to this employment data, the market currently expects a Fed interest rate cut in September 2025 with a probability of 100%, based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool. The Ministry of Finance and Bank Indonesia on Monday (8/9) stated that burden sharing will be conducted prudently. Under this scheme, Bank Indonesia will pay a higher interest rate on government deposit placements to help fund housing and cooperative programs initiated by President Prabowo Subianto's administration. The Ministry of Finance and Bank Indonesia stated that this higher interest rate will be paid until the end of the program, although neither detailed the specific interest rate, the amount paid, nor the duration of the program mentioned. This step was taken amid growing concerns about the impact of these programs on the budget. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that the free trade agreement with the European Union (IEU-CEPA) will be signed on September 23, 2025. Previously, Airlangga stated in June 2025 that the agreement would allow Indonesia to obtain zero tariffs for almost 80% of its export products to the European Union along with the removal of non-tariff barriers. Based on reports from several media outlets, Indonesian commodities subject to tariffs by the European Union include palm oil derivatives with tariff rates around 5-12.8%, biodiesel (palm oil-based) around 8-18%, textiles around 8-12%, and seafood products around 16-20%. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Monday (8/9) that his team targets sales transactions during the 2025 National Online Shopping Day (Harbolnas) to reach 35 trillion rupiah or grow +12.2% YoY compared to the 2024 Harbolnas achievement of 31.2 trillion rupiah. Harbolnas 2025 will be held on December 10-16, 2025. Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of August 2025 decreased to the level of 150.7 billion US dollars (vs. July 2025: 152 billion US dollars). This development was influenced by government foreign debt payments and the policy of stabilizing the rupiah exchange rate. The position of foreign exchange reserves at the end of August 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.3 months of imports or 6.1 months of imports plus government foreign debt payments.

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Gold Resources Officially Announces IPO Plan
tickerNews.content: EMAS: Merdeka Gold Resources, a subsidiary of Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA), plans to hold an IPO by offering up to ~1.6 billion (10%) new shares at a price range of 1,800-3,020 rupiah per share, resulting in proceeds from this corporate action ranging from ~2.9-4.9 trillion rupiah. The IPO proceeds will be used for: 1) 328.4 billion rupiah for staged capital injection into PT Pani Bersama Tambang; 2) 328.4 billion rupiah to be disbursed as a loan to PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera; and 3) the remainder will be used by the company for early debt repayment to MDKA. The public offering period is estimated to take place on September 17-19, 2025, while the listing schedule is set for September 23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific says Chlor-Alkali and Ethylene Dichloride plant construction progress has reached 33%
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific stated on Monday (8/9) that the progress of the construction of the chlor-alkali and ethylene dichloride (CA-EDC) plant project has reached 33%. From an economic perspective, TPIA explained that the ethylene dichloride production from this project is targeted for the export market with the potential to generate foreign exchange up to 5 trillion rupiah per year, while the import substitution of caustic soda produced from this project is projected to provide savings for the country up to 4.9 trillion rupiah per year. Currently, a feasibility study is being conducted to evaluate further downstream potential that can create greater added value, improve efficiency, and strengthen the domestic chemical industry value chain.

tickerNews.title: Providentia Wealth Management Ltd acquires shares in Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama (PACK)
tickerNews.content: PACK: Providentia Wealth Management Ltd purchased ~230.5 million shares of Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama at an average price of 228 rupiah per share on September 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~52.5 billion rupiah and was intended for long-term investment. Following this transaction, the ownership of Providentia Wealth Management Ltd in PACK increased from none to ~14.43%.

tickerNews.title: Adhi Karya's Jabodebek LRT Receivables to be Paid by KAI by End of 2025
tickerNews.content: ADHI: The President Director of Adhi Karya, Entus Asnawi, stated that receivables from the Jabodebek light rail transit (LRT) development project amounting to 2.2 trillion rupiah will be paid by PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) at the earliest by the end of 2025. The Finance Director of ADHI, Bani Iqbal, explained that the receivable settlement process is currently in the discussion stage with the Ministry of Finance, PT KAI, and Danantara.

tickerNews.title: Arabella Sumendap increases direct ownership in Sinar Terang Mandiri (MINE)
tickerNews.content: MINE: The Director of Sinar Terang Mandiri, Arabella Sumendap, purchased ~75.6 million shares of MINE at an average price of 467 rupiah per share on September 2, 2025. The total transaction value reached 35.3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the direct ownership portion of Arabella Sumendap in MINE increased from none to 1.85%.

tickerNews.title: PT Basis Utama Prima increases ownership in Pakuan (UANG), linked to RAJA and MINA shareholders
tickerNews.content: UANG: PT Basis Utama Prima purchased ~196.4 million shares of Pakuan at a price of 467 rupiah per share on September 3, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~91.7 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Basis Utama Prima in UANG increased from none to 16.24%. PT Basis Utama Prima is a company owned by Happy Hapsoro, who is also a shareholder in Rukun Raharja (RAJA) and Sanurhasta Mitra (MINA).
